derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from medieval Latin permissibilis, from permiss- 'allowed', from the verb permittere (see permit)

entry.def: If something is permissible, it is considered to be acceptable because it does not break any laws or rules.

example.ex: Religious practices are permissible under the Constitution...
example.tran: 宪法允许进行宗教活动。

example.ex: He said it was just not  permissible to postpone the main issue by allowing business to carry on as usual.
example.tran: 他说决不允许因为日常工作而耽搁了重大问题。

means.word_mean: 1. that may be permitted especially as according to rule;
2. that may be accepted or conceded;

sentences.sentence: "a kind of speculation that was permissible in cosmology but inadmissible in medicine"

auth_sentence.content: Limited use of the smiley may be permissible, however.

auth_sentence.content: To always forgive is permissible, even appropriate.

auth_sentence.content: I do not consider that a permissible variation.
